memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, string keyword, ComparisonOperator comparisonOperator, LogicalOperator logicalOperator, params string[] fieldNames)
memberdef.name: CreateExpression

briefdescription.para: Creates a "google-like" attribute expression query filter based on the specified keyword.

simplesect.para: Returns a string representing the query necessary to locate the keyword.

simplesect.para: Returns a string representing the query necessary to locate the keyword.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source)
memberdef.name: CreateNew

briefdescription.para: Creates a feature in the table with the default values.

simplesect.para: Returns a IFeature representing the new feature.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, IQueryFilter filter, Func< IFeature, TResult > selector)
memberdef.name: Fetch< TResult >

briefdescription.para: Queries for the features that satisfies the attribute and/or spatial query as specified by an filter object and projects the results into a new form.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute and/or spatial requirement that the features must satisify.
Projects each element of a sequence into a new form.

simplesect.para: Returns a List<TResult> representing the results of the query projected to the type.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, int oid)
memberdef.name: Fetch

briefdescription.para: Returns the row from the source with the specified oid when feature row doesn't exist it will return null.

parameterdescription.para: The key for the feature in the table.

simplesect.para: Returns an IFeature representing the feature for the oid; otherwise null

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, Func< IFeature, bool > action, bool recycling=true)
memberdef.name: Fetch

briefdescription.para: Queries for the all features and executes the specified action on each feature returned from the query.

parameterdescription.para: The action to take for each feature in the cursor.
if set to true when the cursor rehydrates a single row object on each fetch and can be used to optimize read-only access.

simplesect.para: Returns a int representing the number of features affected by the action.

detaileddescription.para: Uses a recycling cursors rehydrate a single feature object on each fetch and can be used to optimize read-only access

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, IQueryFilter filter, Action< IFeature > action, bool recycling=true)
memberdef.name: Fetch

briefdescription.para: Queries for the features that satisfies the attribute and/or spatial query as specified by an filter object and executes the specified action on each feature returned from the query.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute and/or spatial requirement that the features must satisify.
The action to take for each feature in the cursor.
if set to true when the cursor rehydrates a single row object on each fetch and can be used to optimize read-only access.

simplesect.para: Returns a int representing the number of features affected by the action.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, IQueryFilter filter, Func< IFeature, bool > action, bool recycling=true)
memberdef.name: Fetch

briefdescription.para: Queries for the features that satisfies the attribute and/or spatial query as specified by an filter object and executes the specified action on each feature returned from the query.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute and/or spatial requirement that the features must satisify.
The action to take for each feature in the cursor.
if set to true when a recycling memory for the features is used.

simplesect.para: Returns a int representing the number of features affected by the action.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IObjectClass source, string delta)
memberdef.name: GetDeltaTableName

briefdescription.para: Gets the name of the delta (either the A or D) table for the versioned source .

parameterdescription.para: The versioned table or feature class.
The delta (indicate the A or D) table.

simplesect.para: Returns a string representing the name of the delta table.

parameterdescription.para: The delta string must be 1 char long. or The delta string must contain only 'A' or 'D' chars. or The table must be versioned for it have a delta table.
The delta string must be 1 char long. or The delta string must contain only 'A' or 'D' chars.

memberdef.name: GetSchemaName

briefdescription.para: Gets the name of the owner or schema name of the table.

simplesect.para: Returns a string representing the name of the owner.

simplesect.para: Returns a IEnumerable<T> representing code and name of the subtypes; otherwise null.

memberdef.name: GetSubtypeName

briefdescription.para: Gets the subtype name that has the specified subtypeCode .

simplesect.para: Returns a int representing the name of the subtype; otherwise null.

memberdef.name: GetSubtypes

briefdescription.para: Gets the subtype code and name that are assigned to the source.

simplesect.para: Returns a IEnumerable<T> representing code and name of the subtypes; otherwise null.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, IQueryFilter filter, Predicate< IField > predicate, string elementName="Table")
memberdef.name: GetXDocument

briefdescription.para: Converts the contents returned from the attribute or spatial query into an XML document.

parameterdescription.para: The attribute or spatial query filter.
The predicate to determine if the field should be included; otherwise null for all fields.

simplesect.para: Returns a XDocument representing the contents of the query.

memberdef.argsstring: (this IFeatureClass source, esriSQLPrivilege privilege)
memberdef.name: HasPrivileges

briefdescription.para: Determines whether the connected user has the specificed privileges to the feature class.

parameterdescription.para: The privilege (values may be bitwise OR'd together if more than one privilege applies).

simplesect.para: Returns a bool representing true the privilage is supported; otherwise false

Provides extension methods for the ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IClass and ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IObjectClass interfaces.
